intro: Bocconia frutescens f. glaucescens, commonly known as the blue bocconia, is a compact shrub characterized by its striking blue-gray foliage. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of South America. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its foliage is densely hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance and giving it a somewhat woolly texture. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
